result.execSummary:
The defendant Magarayo T Manuel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Magarayo T Manuel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Magarayo T Manuel was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Agent in court requesting modification of the No Contact order to a No Violent Contact order. Court orders the No Violent Contact order.

Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed. Per request of defense attorney, court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve  90  DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 90 days;  TIME SERVED.

Court placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 60 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- No violations of the law that rise to the level of probable cause
- Attend and successfully complete a BIP training program
- Mental Health evaluation
- Take all prescribed medications
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the court
 - injunction in place to 2017
- Comply with any TRO or injunction
- 3rd party contact for purpose of child visitation - must be supervised by an adult before the parenting program is completed
- Seek/maintain employment - defendant should do some work (Example 10 hours per week and/or community service)
- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments (this includes victim/witness, domestic violence and DNA surcharge).  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Dept. of Corrections
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 08-14-2015

NOTE:  Probation sentence as to all five cases is concurrent

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Jury trial is vacated

Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has five cases before the court.

As to Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 1  DISMISSED.

As to Count 3 and Count 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 3 and Count 4  DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Magarayo T Manuel not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Defendant was not produced today's date.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-23-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
Upon the request of Attorney Colin McGinn, Final Pretrial Conference rescheduled in Branch 4 from 4-17-2015 at 8:30 am to 4-14-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
with all conditions of bail continued, including gps supervision and 24 hour gps supervision if released.   mld

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Magarayo T Manuel not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $750.00 on each of the cases; 2014CM2329, 2014CM3503, 2014CM4557, with continued gps supervision.  Court ordered 24 hour gps supervision (if released).  All the discovery for the five (5) cases has now been turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-17-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-4-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

for Modification of Bond - No Contact and Cash Bail, from defense, received and filed.
-- Motion Hearing scheduled for Branch 4 on 3-4-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Goggins.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  All available discovery and offer letter received by defense counsel.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  

Upon the Motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: 2014CM2329, 2014CM3503, 2014CM4557, 2014CM4621 and 2015CF415.  

Case adjourned for FInal Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-17-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 5-4-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CRYSTAL M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Magarayo T Manuel in custody.  William Nathaniel Gale Barron appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
